intro: Chaerophyllum ciliatum, commonly known as the hairy parsley or slender cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, feather-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Chaerophyllum ciliatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along woodland edges, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
